title: 24 Memes for “Adults” Stuck Between a Job and a Hard Place
description: Let's start with the good news. We're all in the same boat here, navigating the same narrative, living in the same timeline. Solidarity, right? The bad news is that the boat is the Titanic, the setting is Groundhog Day, and nobody's getting off. Not exactly the inspirational pep talk you were hoping for, but hey, at least we're sinking together. Over and over again.Unfortunately for us, we've landed in a time of limbo. We're all stuck. If you want to feel a little better about it, just think of yourself as a Greek myth—you're Sisyphus. Hooray! Us modern mythical beings seem to exist in two states: either desperately looking (or let's be honest, begging) for a job or hating the one we already have. Yay! It's like a rollercoaster ride with one single loop that just repeats forever. Thrilling.
author: Etai Eshet

title: ‘Could we just get it over with and ’do it your way?'': Rookie tow boat drivers put in their place after tattling on their senior barge manager, then they end up begging him for help when their undercooked plan backfires
description: Rookies rarely know what they're doing in blue-collar fields, yet unsurprisingly, every time a new hire walks through the doors, they act like they're king of the barge. This senior boatman and expert on the docks was aware of every greenhorn's shortcomings, but after getting scorned for insisting on doing things his way—the right way—he decided to let the newbie sailors flop on the deck with their undercooked ideas. Don't fix what ain't broken!
author: Jesse Kessenheimer

title: The Glam Gals
description: “My mom and I did “mother/daughter” glamour shots at a local motel in a janky hotel room in the late 90s. The photographer thought it would be a lovely idea to have us sit back to back and be encircled by black and white feather boas. He also commented on my “beautiful eyes.” At the time,... The post The Glam Gals appeared first on AwkwardFamilyPhotos.com.

title: 21 Sleepy Cat Memes to Send Your Boss so They'll Give You Mandatory Nap Time
description: Hello, cat pawrents! Or should we say "Good meowrning"? We're sure we need to tell that to your cat, at least, because while you were waking up this morning, they were still sleeping; while you were drinking your morning coffee, your cat was still sleeping; while you were leaving the house to go to work, your cat was still sleeping; while you started to do your job, taking care of all your responsibilities, being a good employee, guess what? Your cat was still sleeping.Wouldn't you like to sleep like your cat? We know we would. Like, we wouldn't object to sleeping 16 hours a day and then nap for at least 4 hours more. Sounds like a purrfect sleeping schedule to us. But that's why we look at all these sleepy cat memes all the time - because we'd like to be deep in sleep like them, because they're cats.So here we are, looking at these memes, and thinking they need to be shared. There you go, these sleepy cat memes are here for you to use. Send them to your boss - they might send you for some mandatory sleeping time. You have nothing to lose.
author: Ayala Sorotsky

title: Younger boyfriend moves in with his 26-year-old girlfriend but refuses to get along with her cat, so she breaks up with him to protect her precious pet: ‘[My pets] always come first’
description: Happy Wednesday, friends and felines. Cats have always been our furst love, and anything else comes in second, including boyfriends and girlfriends. That's just the way it is. Hoomans come and go, but our relationship with our cats is one that has saved us, brought us joy, and made our lives better time and time again. We wouldn't trade them for the world, so if a potential partner doesn't get along with our cats, we can say with purrfect certainty that it is a huge red flag.They don't have to love our sweet kitties as much as we do (as if anyone ever could), but they at least have to enjoy their purresence and give them the respect they deserve. If they don't, it's time to kick them to the curb and start something new. We know that may sound pawsitively harsh, but believe us, if they don't like pets, they'll never fully merge with your lifestyle. That's why when this younger boyfriend moved in with his feline-fanatic girlfriend, they ran into a situation messier than our cat's litter box. Scroll through the full thread below!
author: Blake Seidel

title: Liar Wolf
description: I saw a video of two puppies howling, and the text 'ertop said that they were "dire wolves resurrected by man's cold god, Science." We were allowed to enjoy this moment for about five minutes before people started coming in with their facts and shit. If you listen to their Chief Science Officer, she will say they are using the "morphological species concept" which means that if it looks like a Dire Wolf and howls like a Dire Wolf, then it's a Dire Wolf. That seems weird to me. Am I dumb? Am I the stupid one, here?

description: Y’all. I’ve been a bit of a wreck lately and part of that is another bout of pernicious anemia (which absolutely sounds like a Lemony Snicket disease) and also some other autoimmune disease (BECAUSE I GUESS I DON’T HAVE ENOUGH?) that I haven’t been able to get tested for because the doctor says I’m tooContinue reading "A happy cry"

author: thebloggess

title: CodeSOD: Single or Mingle
description: Singletons is arguably the easiest to understand design pattern, and thus, one of the most frequently implemented design patterns, even- especially- when it isn't necessary. Its simplicity is its weakness. Bartłomiej inherited some code which implemented this pattern many, many times. None of them worked quite correctly, and all of them tried to create a singleton a different way. For example, this one: public class SystemMemorySettings { private static SystemMemorySettings _instance; public SystemMemorySettings() { if (_instance == null) { _instance = this; } } public static SystemMemorySettings GetInstance() { return _instance; } public void DoSomething() { ... // (this must only be done for singleton instance - not for working copy) if (this != _instance) { return; } ... } } The only thing they got correct was the static method which returns an instance, but everything else is wrong. They construct the instance in the constructor, meaning this isn't actually a singleton, since you can construct it multiple times. You just can't use it. And you can't use it because of the real "magic" here: DoSomething, which checks if the currently active instance is also the originally constructed instance. If it isn't, this function just fails silently and does nothing. A common critique of singletons is that they're simply "global variables with extra steps," but this doesn't even succeed at that- it's just a failure, top to bottom. [Advertisement] Keep the plebs out of prod. Restrict NuGet feed privileges with ProGet. Learn more.
author: Remy Porter

title: CodeSOD: Insanitize Your Inputs
description: Honestly, I don't know what to say about this code sent to us by Austin, beyond "I think somebody was very confused". string text; text = ""; // snip box.Text = text; text = ""; text = XMLUtil.SanitizeXmlString(text); This feels like it goes beyond the usual cruft and confusion that comes with code evolving without ever really being thought about, and ends up in some space outside of meaning. It's all empty strings, signifying nothing, but we've sanitized it. [Advertisement] Keep the plebs out of prod. Restrict NuGet feed privileges with ProGet. Learn more.

title: Galapagos Tortoises Become First-Time Parents At 100
description: A pair of critically endangered, nearly 100-year-old Galapagos tortoises at the Philadelphia Zoo have become first-time parents, with the arrival of the four hatchlings being a first in the zoo’s more than 150-year history. What do you think? The post Galapagos Tortoises Become First-Time Parents At 100 appeared first on The Onion.
